Intervention: Effect of bright light on fatigue in women with breast cancer
effect of red light on fatigue in women with breast cancer
Eligibility: metastatic or inoperable (including inflammatory) breast cancer
history of other axis-I psychiatric disorder
Results: The Short Form of the Multidimensional Fatigue Symptom Inventory (MFSI-sf) was used to measure fatigue. The range of possible score for each subscale is 0 to 24, and the range for total score is -24 to 96, with a higher score indicating more severe fatigue, except for the Vigor subscale, where larger score indicates less fatigue.
Time frame: four cycles of chemotherapy
Arm/Group Title: Effect of Bright Light
Arm/Group Description: Effect of bright light on fatigue in women with breast cancer
Unit of Measure: units on a scale  15.25         (5.5)
Arm/Group Title: Effect of Red Light
Arm/Group Description: effect of red light on fatigue in women with breast cancer
Unit of Measure: units on a scale  21.6         (7.2)
